Alain Lefevre.Action: Slips his arms around two women, seductively whispers to one, and laughs coquettishly while entering the club.
Gives Maxim an affectionate tap on the cheek and winks, smiling while teasing him.
Arrives late, causing Maxim frustration and making things difficult for him.
Arrives fashionably late with two women, displaying cocky and flamboyant behavior; does not immediately align with Maxim's urgent needs.
Maintains confidence and charm despite Maxim's frustration; uses affectionate teasing to defuse tension.
Graciously helps Paulette with her cloak and engages Yvonne warmly by pretending to know her name and involving her in the interaction.
Ignores Maxim's protest and discomfort while charming the Hat Check Girl and giving her a big tip, showing polite and friendly behavior.
Dismisses Maxim's complaints about effort and physical condition without acknowledgment, focusing instead on his own social charm.
Gracefully manages social interactions by smoothly directing others to assist Paulette, maintaining composure while handling multiple tasks.
Confidently navigates flirtatious attention, responding with charm and a generous tip, demonstrating social skill and control.
Ignores Maxim's appeals and concerns about the difficulty of the situation, potentially missing a chance to coordinate or acknowledge effort.
Effectively leads the women and controls the moment by guiding them to the stairway with ease and grace.
Tells Maxim to relax and reassures him that they make a great team.
Jokes about having the 'broads' while Maxim has the brains.
Holds a chair out for Paulette politely.
Responds cockily to being told he is late.
Advises Maxim to relax and shows confidence in their partnership ('You got the brains... I got the broads.'), indicating social ease and self-assurance.
Arrives late to a meeting with a powerful figure but responds cockily ('Better that than never.'), demonstrating confidence though possibly poor timing.
Engages casually and somewhat disrespectfully with dangerous men (Galgani and crew) without apparent planning or precaution, potentially risking the business interaction.
Opts to be easygoing in an uncomfortable situation, avoiding confrontation despite insult.
Pats Paulette on the fanny before sending the women away.
Conceals elation at a business offer, maintaining a cool demeanor.
Directly refuses to throw the fight despite pressure, asserting personal integrity.
Calmly defuses a tense situation by choosing to be easygoing despite an insult, managing social dynamics with subtlety.
Conceals true emotions upon receiving a lucrative but compromising offer, maintaining composure to weigh options.
Milks tension deliberately and confidently by lighting a cigarette and staring down the antagonist, displaying control and courage.
Rejects corrupt proposal to intentionally lose a match, asserting personal integrity despite risk.
Does not intervene or defend himself when accused of potentially throwing a fight, remains silent and scrutinizes others realizing trouble.
Remains calm and scrutinizes the situation, realizing he and Maxim are in trouble, showing awareness and presence of mind.
Failing to intervene or speak when Maxim is pleading on his behalf, appearing paralyzed and fixated on Katrina instead of the negotiation at hand.
Makes a pointed remark to Galgani about his problem with the female gender.
Does not intervene when Galgani forcibly grabs Katrina and causes her pain.
Accepts the deal to fight, seemingly influenced by Rene's money and taunts, without apparent concern for Katrina's distress.
Calmly accepts a dangerous deal under pressure instead of reacting emotionally.
Insults Galgani, provoking tension in an already volatile situation.
Immediately arranges payment terms and takes control of the negotiation.
Wistfully fingers a gold cross and chain, showing vulnerability and nostalgia.
Offers Katrina an empty chair with an arrogant smile.
Looks at his pocket watch but seems insecure and unhinged, then replaces it.
Fingers a gold cross wistfully while drinking wine, showing vulnerability and nostalgia.
Notices Katrina approaching and quickly hides the cross, then confidently rises and offers her a chair with an arrogant smile.
Enters the boxing ring determined, focused on the fight, but seems disconnected from Katrina's emotional distress described in voice-over.
Enters the boxing ring determined, focused on the fight ahead, maintaining composure despite the unusual, hallucinatory atmosphere.
Ritually secures a small gold cross and chain from his glove into his robe pocket before the fight
Concentrates on the fight without explaining his secretive actions immediately
Intentionally takes hits, deliberately appearing weak to the crowd despite personal cost
Ritually removes the gold cross and chain from his boxing glove and pockets it before the fight starts, showing careful preparation and awareness of the situation.
Goes to fight with Julot, but intentionally takes punches and staggers backward leaving himself open, allowing himself to be hit repeatedly.
Grabs onto Julot to stall for time when being pummeled, indicating some tactical thinking under pressure.
Moves around the ring giving Julot every opportunity to hit him, which disappoints the crowd and results in boos.
Ignores Maxim's encouragement, concentrating on opponent Julot instead of trainer's support.
Responds briefly and affirmatively to Maxim's urging to stay focused, showing some compliance.
Pursues opponent aggressively, unaffected by punches, showing determination not interpersonal warmth.
Delivers powerful, vengeful blows to opponent despite coach's disapproval, indicating possible rebelliousness or lack of teamwork.
Ignores trainer's instructions and acts on his own impulse by aggressively attacking Julot contrary to the plan.
Maintains focus and composure during the fight, avoids punches skillfully.
Throws his glove at Maxim's stomach in a tense moment, then calls out for a knife.
Lands a decisive uppercut knocking out opponent Julot, eliciting massive crowd cheer and victory.
Quickly jumps from the ring and tries to untie glove laces to ready for next action.
Throws glove at Maxim to draw attention and signals 'Knife. Knife!' showing quick thinking and signaling danger.
Thanks an unsuspecting fan for their overcoat before escaping.
Calmly reassures Maxim despite dangerous circumstances.
Mentions past relationship with Katrina, showing sincerity.
Uses a deceptive plan to escape pursuit, not revealing true intentions to Maxim.
Calmly arranges an escape plan under pressure, assures Maxim despite imminent threat.
Confidently uses an unsuspecting fan's overcoat to disguise himself and facilitates a quick exit.
Has already secured tickets to leave the country, showing foresight and preparation.
Dismisses Maxim's fear and confusion confidently, maintaining control of the situation.
Does not react with panic despite being chased by multiple enemies and law enforcement.
Tries to reassure Maxim by reminding him they’re going to America, attempting to keep spirits up.
Stops Maxim to give him the cross and reassures him 'trust me, they're gone', showing concern and care.
Holds Maxim as he dies, providing comfort in final moments.
Stops Maxim to assess situation, tells him to slow down after realizing they may have lost pursuers.
Takes the cross from Maxim and puts it on himself, showing presence of mind and perhaps preparing for what may come.
Confidently tells Maxim 'Trust me. They're gone.' after assessing the situation.
Despite telling Maxim to trust him and that pursuers are gone, Alain is caught off guard when Rene's car and thugs appear and attack, leading to Maxim being shot.
Remorsefully glances back at Maxim after dropping him and fleeing.
Avoids confrontation with the gendarmes initially by sidestepping them.
Struggles violently with Gendarme #1 for control of the weapon.
Remorsefully glances back at Maxim before fleeing, showing emotional awareness amidst danger.
Quickly moves through shadows and tries to evade capture by side-stepping two gendarmes unnoticed initially.
Gets caught and knocked down by gendarmes despite trying to escape, indicating a failure at evasion.
Springs to his feet quickly after being taken down and engages in a physical struggle to disarm a gendarme.
In the struggle, crashes off balance and seems to lose control momentarily.
Drops the Gendarme sprinting away, then glances over his shoulder while fleeing.
Drops the Gendarme running away, escapes initial pursuit.
Looks over his shoulder when hearing approaching footsteps, scans escape routes when trapped.
Crashes into a barrel while fleeing, indicating some clumsiness under pressure.
Emerges quickly to escape the gendarmes, showing resourcefulness but no visible concern for others.
Kills a Gendarme boxer during a chase, evades pursuers by hiding under a tarp and slips away successfully.
Sprints into a Legion recruiting office, out of breath and flustered, showing signs of physical exertion but quickly takes cover and scans the room.
Nervously interacts with the Recruiting Sergeant, trying not to stare and showing signs of vulnerability.
Does not respond to the Recruiting Sergeant's sarcastic and somewhat dismissive remarks, maintains composure.
Tries to maintain composure despite feeling flustered and claustrophobic in the recruiting office, cautiously takes a seat and tries not to stare.
Responds nervously and evasively when asked about his reasons for joining the Legion, showing uncertainty and lack of confidence in his explanation.
Quickly fills out the recruitment form without hesitation.
Fits in with a group of misfits, suggesting tolerance and adaptability.
Peers over his shoulder at another recruit, showing curiosity but no obvious warmth.
Quickly fills out the recruitment form without hesitation, demonstrating decisiveness and prompt action.
Appears nervous and tries to cover it when questioned about involvement with a woman, indicating some insecurity.
Shares cigarette and match with Guido Rosetti without much verbal interaction but non-verbally acknowledges him.
Sits alone apart from the group, watching others from a distance without engaging.
Calmly observes courtyard activity alone, appearing focused and reserved.
Efficiently produces cigarette and lights match for Guido without distraction.
Lights Guido's cigarette with a wooden match without delay.
Flicks the match into the yard after lighting cigarette, a neutral action.
Remains unresponsive and silent while Guido shares personal, emotional stories and tries to bond.
Allows Guido to lean against the wall beside him, showing some acceptance.
Successfully lights a cigarette with a wooden match stick without hesitation or failure.
Flicks the match into the yard without hesitation, indicating confidence and control.
Remains unresponsive and silent while Guido expresses his hopes and dreams, showing emotional detachment or disengagement.
Offers to help Katrina with her luggage, showing concern though she initially rebuffs him.
Smiles to himself watching Katrina, indicating a gentle, friendly demeanor.
Darts his eyes to Luther's bloody nose after Legros beats him.
Darts his eyes to Luther's bloody nose, showing awareness of the situation and other characters' states.
Cuts Luther's hair despite the humiliating context, initiates a handshake and introduces himself sincerely.
Uses the term 'neger' self-referentially to identify shared suffering among men.
Glances at the Corporals laughing at Luther but does not intervene or object.
Holds his glare steady when challenged by Sergeant Steinkampf, refusing to back down.
Cuts Luther's hair without hesitation despite the charged atmosphere and hostility around.
Engages with Luther diplomatically, offering his hand and sharing his name to build rapport.
Does not respond verbally to Steinkampf’s criticism about arrogance or fog over his eyes.
Maintains composure and follows orders despite harsh treatment (firehose), showing resilience.
Engages in witty, confident banter with Luther, indicating social awareness and confidence.
Demonstrates tactical social understanding by advising Luther not to push Bruner too far.
Hands a cigarette to Luther and calmly responds 'It's okay' when Luther apologizes for earlier behavior.
Listens quietly to Luther's painful racial experiences without interrupting or dismissing.
Places his tray on the table and walks off, avoiding confrontational dialogue with Luther.
Shares his cigarette with Luther calmly and accepts an apology with minimal reaction.
Stares out the window alone, appearing introspective rather than taking initiative or engaging proactively.
Empathizes quietly with Luther's story of being falsely accused and on the run.
Expresses excitement and shares hope for a better future with Katrina, showing affectionate and optimistic behavior.
Empathizes with Luther's difficult situation, showing understanding and emotional intelligence.
Confidently shares news about securing a high-stakes fight, demonstrating progress and ambition toward a goal.
Rushes to Katrina and spins her, showing enthusiasm and confidence in their shared dream.
Stops Luther from intervening in Guido's beating and moves toward Bruner.
Stops Luther from intervening and moves to confront Bruner himself.
Intervenes to protect a kid from being attacked by Bruner, physically restrains Bruner to prevent violence.
Engages in a violent fight after being sucker-punched.
Engages in a brutal, ruthless fight and pummels opponent relentlessly
Staggers into a fellow soldier's arms, showing no apparent impatience or rejection
Helps Guido carry his heavy pack by lifting him up and aiding him through the march.
Returns to the obstacle course to assist Guido when he freezes, enabling them to finish the drill together.
Looks perplexed and struggles with washing his clothes alone, showing vulnerability.
Receives help from comrades without resistance or complaint.
Drops clothes into barrel and makes a feeble attempt at washing, unable to get the dirt out.
Kneels staring into the barrel, showing confusion and lack of washing skill.
Abruptly shouts 'Stop!' to end the argument about washing clothes, then takes charge of washing his own garments.
Stops the ongoing argument abruptly, asserts control over washing task, indicating confidence and decisiveness.
Makes a better-than-fair showing as a marksman on the rifle range despite being a first timer.
Despite anxiety, he steps up to shoot under pressure of public and authoritative expectation, showing willingness to perform a difficult task.
Requests to be excused from the shooting, signaling a moment of doubt or lack of confidence.
Joins comrades and assumes correct shooting position quickly, indicating preparedness and discipline.
Passes by the violent bar fight indifferent and unengaged, showing possible detachment or lack of situational involvement.
Walks past drunken Legionnaires fighting without intervening or showing concern.

Smiles gallantly and observes the situation without intervening in the exploitation of Guido

Inches himself slowly into the chair, appearing preoccupied and disengaged

Loses himself in loving thought while gazing at Katrina and dancing sensuously with her.

Carefully undresses Katrina without breaking gaze, gently lowers her to the bed and relishes their intimate moment.
Avoids Mackintosh's eyes but offers to buy a drink and acknowledges Mackintosh’s order with a nod, indicating cordiality.
Pays close attention to surroundings while waiting at the bar, scans the room and acknowledges Mackintosh with a nod, indicating alertness and situational awareness.
Avoids direct eye contact with Mackintosh by rising from the table and heading to the bar, possibly signaling discomfort or avoidance.
Slips away in disguise to avoid detection; moves quickly through a dangerous alley, showing awareness and caution.
Confronts Mackintosh by shoving him aside and attempting to leave despite orders, showing determination but also recklessness.
Crashes into trash barrels causing noise and attracting attention, indicating clumsiness or poor situational control.
Ducks to avoid Mackintosh's punches and attempts to de-escalate and reason, demonstrating quick reflexes and emotional intelligence.
Turns away from Guido, not engaging warmly when greeted.
Listens attentively to Mackintosh's confession about dishonor and personal struggle.
Engages in quiet conversation in the dark, showing a willingness to be a confidant.
Turns away from Guido, maintaining focus on Mackintosh, reassuring that everything is fine despite tension.
Engages Mackintosh in a serious and reflective conversation about honor and personal failure, showing emotional intelligence.
Does not intervene or offer solutions to Mackintosh's gambling-related problems or dishonorable discharge.
Reflects on his inattentiveness and broken promise to Katrina, showing awareness of his faults.
Grabs Katrina's arm during an argument, contributing to conflict.
Removes gold chain and turns photograph to the wall, indicating avoidance or reluctance to face emotional issues.
Acknowledges his selfishness the night before the wedding, showing insight and vulnerability.
Acknowledges his emotional shortcomings and reflects on the personal consequences of his behavior, showing self-awareness.
Gets distracted by his social status and entourage instead of focusing on his relationship, leading to conflict and emotional harm.
Demonstrates inability to fully commit or prepare mentally for important life changes, revealing hesitation and lack of readiness.
Hesitates, unsure how to react to Katrina’s pain but stops her when she tries to leave, offering to help her despite their estrangement.
Admits he didn't have the courage to confront Katrina directly and expresses regret over past mistakes.
Sits alone smoking numerous cigarettes, showing signs of self-blame and emotional turmoil over his failures.
Determines to find Katrina and prove he cares, asking a friend for help.
Admits he doesn't know how far the fort is when asked by Guido.
Comforts Guido by encouraging him and reassuring him that he will make it.

Encourages a fellow soldier, Guido, to keep hope and focus on reaching the fort despite exhaustion and fear.
Promises to inform Guido's loved one if he fails, showing emotional support and responsibility.
Expresses concern about Guido's injured foot and asks why he didn't speak up.

Takes care of Guido's wounds by wiping blood off and wrapping his feet.
Encourages the group to stick together and reassures Guido directly to maintain morale.
Takes charge in attending to Guido's wounds by wiping blood and wrapping the wounds.
Seeks physical connection (reaches for Guido's foot) to provide comfort but respects Guido’s reluctance (Guido pulls away).
Rushes to help broken Guido, encourages him to get up despite others' harshness.
Opposes Legros and Steinkampf's cold orders, tries to protect Guido from being forced to continue.
Reminds Steinkampf of the Legion as a family and refuses to abandon a friend.
Drops his rifle to help Guido, showing empathy and willingness to physically assist a struggling comrade.
Attempts to convince both Guido and others to allow rest and recovery rather than forcing continuation, demonstrating situational judgment and concern for mental/physical limits.
Confronts Steinkampf's harsher view on Guido's condition with emotional reasoning about the Legion being a family, showing moral conviction but possibly softness in command decisions.
Allows Legros to roughly shove him aside and nearly loses the effort to help Guido, suggesting limitations in authority or physical dominance.
Hoists the exhausted Guido onto his back despite the hardship, insisting they will make it together.
Hoists unconscious Guido onto his back and insists they will make it together despite the harsh conditions.
Shows determination and physical capability under extreme heat and exhaustion.
Depleted, Alain trudges toward the water hole with Guido across his shoulders and gently releases him.
Tells Guido that he is safe and instructs him to keep down despite Guido wanting to fight.

Tells Guido to stay put for safety despite Guido wanting to fight.
Engages the enemy effectively, shooting down an attacker.
Runs out of ammunition at a critical moment, leaving himself vulnerable.
Is held prisoner with tied wrists, no visible resistance or complaints shown in excerpt.
Is captured with wrists tied behind his back, appearing defeated and crushed along with others, offering no visible resistance or defense.

Faces down threats from Viktor and Julot, maintaining composure without retaliation, later thanks them ironically.
Expresses gratitude ironically toward antagonists, signaling acceptance of harsh reality and possibly a guarded sincerity.
Breaks into a knowing smile and declares a renewed will to live upon being challenged, indicating openness to change and hope.
Becomes suspicious during the patrol selection, showing caution but not distrust or hostility outright.
Laughs in a tense situation, showing emotional resilience and defiance.
Faces down antagonists Viktor and Julot with intense glare and composed responses.
Expresses a thoughtful change in attitude about the Legion and his will to survive.

Exhibits tension and sweat due to nervousness before the ambush, but stays alert ready to act.

Deep in thought during a quiet moment in the canteen, indicating reflection and situational awareness.

Unflinchingly faces imminent threat (gunshot, hostile rifles) without hesitation or fear, maintaining steady composure.
